1147921756595687427.text: What makes this a particularly tragic tweet is that I interviewed Ozonoff at the MIND Institute, who told me even her trained experts, watching slowed-down videos, were not able to spot which autistic sibs would eventually show signs. The "completely typical" stuff is just wrong.https://twitter.com/ShireenQudosi/status/1139023857912729601 …

1147969223848648704.text: I'm curious about this. Are you saying that up until some age, this group could not tell autistic infants from NT? If so, until what age?

1147965951364800513.text: What’s also so sad to me, Steve, is this Shireen person is most likely neglecting the kid in front of her, ignoring his needs for sensory & self-regulation support, in favor of trying to “return him to normal” with abusive “therapies”.

1147948622916595712.text: I'm a parent too and I reject these pseudo science nutjobs. But like Trump supporters, there are more than you realize.

1148303327756738561.text: I suppose the 'good' news is that most replies and comments back to her are giving her very little credibility or love.  It is mostly critical, factual feedback to her BS.

1147943551369711616.text: you don’t need to be a scientist or MD to know that the phrase “a completely typical kid” is nonsensical. Are we completely typical adults? I just spent the weekend with a few dozen kids. “Typical” for that (unscientific) sample means only that they were all under ~15.

1147923739545362433.text: It's really too bad she's been fighting with autistic twitter.

1147970144347414528.text: I hear you about this. In the special needs parent community, I think there is reinforcement to the fighter parent who is turning over every stone to find an answer vs the parent who quietly and methodically provides for needs. That's something that needs fixing.

1148012860578107393.text: Mmm. The way her thread deteriotes as she expresses more of her thoughts is just horribly scary.

1148213798458839040.text: 5 autistic children, none vaccinated until after diagnosis. Neurodevelopmental doesn't mean acquired. Only thing that matters  is ensuring the childs needs are met with respect and dignity, that they feel loved and accepted for their unique selves always
